Description: Tondo and foot sherd of Attic black-figured pottery stemless cup; interior, in tondo, black-figure decoration consisting of warrior (head and feet missing; carrying chlamys in his left hand and sword or lagobolon in his right), to right; band of single added red dots around tondo; exterior: glazed black with single reserved band; on underside of foot, black band.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Greco-Roman Museum, Alexandria. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Venit 1988 / Greek Painted Pottery from Naukratis in Egyptian Museums (p. 92 no. 315 pl. 68)
Venit 1982 / Painted Pottery from the Greek Mainland found in Egypt, 640-450 BC (p. 445-6, no. B735, pl. XXIX, pl. CCXXI)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.1553) (phase 3)
